intro: Sium latijugum, commonly known as broad-leaf water pepper, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant has small, white flowers that bloom in clusters, and its leaves are alternate, with a slightly toothed margin. It typically grows in wet or marshy areas, thriving in moist soil conditions. The plant is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and other waterlogged habitats.
